h3. Summary:
# Prepare a Bitbucket Cloud account with huge DVCS repo (Tested with 3000. # Connect JIRA with the Bitbucket Cloud account above.
# Follow the Wizard.
# Open the DVCS Account page.

h3. Expected Result:
* The page will load with the list of Repos.

h3. Actual Result:
* The page will show the Loading Circle for a quite of time and the browser will crash.

h3. Notes:
* At the previous versions such as 6.3, with the fact that the logs will throw errors as mentioned in [JSW-14296|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-14296] , the page will still load at the end.
* Issue is also reproducible with GitHub

h3. Workaround

We have not been able to identify a workaround for this issue.

h3. Summary

JIRA Cloud import fails when duplicate email address are found in the XML file: failed to import user remotely

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.695.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Log into instance
# JIRA Import Wizard: https://<example>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/StudioImportSelect!start.jspa
# Select file > Import > File imports and begins processing
# During after 2nd reindex, during the User import > Import fails with the error message "Failed to import user remotely"

h3. Expected Results

The import is successful and all users are created.

h3. Actual Results

Import fails as soon as duplicate email is detected. JIRA instance down

Following error is displayed in JIRA Logs:
{code}
2017-01-13 12:49:50.743573500 2017-01-13 12:49:50,742 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR sysadmin 647x859x1  4.15.43.214 /secure/admin/StudioImport!import.jspa [c.a.j.studio.importer.StudioImport] Unexpected error while restoring data: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: Failed to import user remotely
2017-01-13 12:49:50.743576500 com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: Failed to import user remotely
{code}
{code}
2017-01-13 12:49:50.743697500 Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: Failed to import user remotely
{code}
{code}
2017-01-13 12:49:50.743713500 Caused by: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.BadRequestException: {"errorType":"UserAlreadyExists","message":"A user with ExampleName@example.com already exists","data":"ExampleName@example.com"}
{code}

Cannot access the JIRA instance after the failed import

h3. Notes

Related to: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63746 > Addressing the special character issue

h3.Workaround
Remove all duplicate email address, generate a new backup, and use this new backup to perform the import.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud import fails when duplicate email found in backup: failed to import user remotely

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Very poor performance on the project picker dropdown when there are over 3500 projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy a new JIRA instance.
# Use this script to generate 4000 projects, filling the values at the top prior to running it.
{code:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
#!/bin/bash
PROJECTS=4000
JIRA_BASE_URL="http://ecrmac-632.local:54593/PS-9149"
JIRA_USER="admin"
JIRA_PASSWORD="sphere"

for p in $(seq $PROJECTS); do
    echo -n "Creating project $p of $PROJECTS: "
    PKEY=$(LC_CTYPE=C tr -dc A-Z < /dev/urandom | fold -w ${1:-6} | head -n 1)
    curl -u $JIRA_USER:$JIRA_PASSWORD \
       --header "Content-Type:application/json" \
       -X POST \
       -d "{ \"key\": \"$PKEY\", \"name\": \"$PKEY\", \"projectTypeKey\": \"business\", \"lead\": \"$JIRA_USER\" }" \
       $JIRA_BASE_URL/rest/api/2/project
    echo
done
{code}
# Grab a coffee, this will take a while.
# Navigate to *Issues > Search for issues*
# Make sure the basic search is active.
# Click the *Project* dropdown.

h3. Expected Results
Project picker dropdown performs fast like the user picker.

h3. Actual Results
All projects are loaded into the dropdown, taking a long time to render and being generally unresponsive.
 
h3. Notes
* The slowness is much more noticeable on Portfolio, as described in JPO-1791.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Poor performance on project picker when there are over 3500 projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63778].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
- In the documentation and on the description for this report, it says "For a date field and project or filter, maps the issues against the date that the field was set."
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/reporting-764478415.html
- This is incorrect, it's semantics but it very much changes the meaning. The report is based on the date selected in the field. The current language means the date that the field was changed.
- Let's say that today, 14/Dec/16 I set a field to 09/Jan/17, "the date that the field was set" is 14/Dec/16. The report uses the value of the field, 09/Jan/17.

h3. Suggestion
Change the description:
"For a date field and project or filter, maps the issues against the date that the field was set to" or "...the date set in the field".

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Change the description of the Time Since Issues Report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63777].
  {panel}

JIRA Permission Scheme exposes a Browse Project permission which should deny access to the project listing to anyone.

It is a valid configuration having a JIRA Admin who will be able to Create Projects although not have Browse Project permissions.

The "Create Project with Shared Configuration" feature exposes a Project dropdown which lists all the existing projects in the instance, without honor the Browse Project permissions.

Steps to reproduce:

Logged as admin:
 * Create user "foo" in the administrator group (therefore it will have Create Project permissions)
 * Create a "bar" project using Default Permission Scheme
 * In Administration/Permission Schemes, remove administrator group from Browse Projects permission

Logged as foo:
 * Navigate to "Projects"/"View All Projects", you won't be able to visualize "bar" project (correct behavior)
Hit "Projects"/"Create project"
 * Click on the bottom link "Create with shared configuration"
 * In the "Choose a project" dropdown, you'll be able to list the "bar" project (unexpected behavior)
fields.summary: JIRA "Create Project with Shared Configuration" exposes list of projects to admins who don't have Browse Project permissions
Should be able to sort workflow status by project workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63775].
  {panel}

Need to be able to use a filter to identify a collection of open (status) bugs, then create a historical/chronological report that shows the volume of open bugs (e.g. a line chart) per day/week/month over that history. Note that "open" doesn't mean "opened" (as in the verb) but, rather, the status of open.

A couple of suggestions, that do NOT address this, I've seen via web search are:

1) Created vs Resolved Gadget - Shows the cases that are "opened" (open as a verb, not open as a status). Need the 'open status bugs' chronologically.

2) GreenHopper plugin - Shows opened vs resolved, which shows the trend in volume of open status, but not the net volume of open status bugs chronologically.

This is critical to demonstrate whether a particular release is converging on zero open bugs.
fields.summary: Report: Open bug count history (chronology)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63773].
  {panel}

We've recently introduced a transition condition that ensures an issue cannot be resolved if it has an open review.

This often causes confusion because an issue with an open review does not provide any information as to why the resolve button is missing (or the drop target on an agile board). This means users are often confused as to why the button isn't present.

It would be very useful if the button were to be visible but greyed out in some way, with additional details on hover (for example) to describe what conditions are not met so a user can see what they need to do before they can advance in the workflow.

On an agile board, the drop target could be shown in a different colour for a transition with an unmet condition, and a dialogue explaining the unmet condition could show when a user attempts to drag an issue to a drop target.

Permission based conditions could probably be exempt from this, as it may lead to more confusion. Alternatively, an administrator could be given an option when adding a workflow condition to show the transition in a disabled state with a reason rather than hiding the transition completly.
fields.summary: Improve visibility of transition conditions that are not met

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When manually installing an application in a JIRA Core instance through the *Versions & licenses* page, if you choose to upload an application that it is not compatible with the current JIRA Core version, no warnings are displayed to the user. The installation will proceed nroamlly, and when concluded a notification will be displayed that JIRA Core must be updated to match the new application's version.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have JIRA check if the new application is compatible before the installation, and if it is not, display a warning to the admin notifing him of this.

h3. Why this is important
If an admin mistankingly uploads a .obr file for a application not compatible with the current JIRA Core version, this will make it so that application stops functioning. A warming beforehand would prevent this from happening. Also, blocking the installation of non compatible applications may also be an option.
fields.summary: Notify that the application is not compatible before its installation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Issues could not load added Confluence links to page This is a regression of JRA-60872 introduced in 7.2.4. 

There are 2 steps for issue links:
# Adding the link, this could be done in many ways and "mentioned in" is one of them
#* Adding those issue links is outside the scope of current bug.
# Show added link
#* Scope of this bug

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.6
* Confluence 5.10+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create link to Confluence page from JIRA issue

h3. Expected Results
Link is rendered

h3. Actual Results
Link is not rendered
 !JIRA_errorlink_to_confluence.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the jira file:
{noformat}
2017-01-06 12:18:54,474 ajp-nio-8600-exec-512 ERROR admin 738x5030206x3 1jgcvgx 10.1.1.1 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/35092 [c.a.j.p.v.issuelink.rest.RemoteIssueLinkResource] Error occurred while generating final HTML for remote issue link: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Status Code: 200, Status Text: OK, Errors: {}, Error Messages: [java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException]
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Happy flow:
# JIRA fires the XML-RPC call: response = getBlogPost(applicationLink, pageId);
# Confluence sends back some reply: *Blog content*  or *Error*
# JIRA checks the result and checks if this is known error, it expects this:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
<Fault 0: 'java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.pages.BlogPost'>
{code}
# If this is expected error, JIRA fires another the XML-RPC call: response = getGenericPage(applicationLink, pageId);

Due to JIT optimisation, Confluence replies with:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
<?xml version="1.0"?><methodResponse><fault><value><struct><member><name>faultString</name><value>java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException</value></member><member><name>faultCode</name><value><int>0</int></value></member></struct></value></fault></methodResponse>
{code}
Note the difference: 
* java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException
* java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.pages.BlogPost

And that causes link failed to render. 
Related to CONF-45760

h3.Workaround

The problem on the Confluence side is caused due to JVM does JIT optimisation and suppresses stack-trace for frequent errors.
* Restart of the Confluence temporary solves the problem. 
* Disable JIT optimization in Confluence, add to JVM paramerts: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
-XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow
{code}

*Update 2017-02-20*: A bugfix is being delivered in the next patch versions of JIRA. Until those are released, you can use one of the attached versions of the Confluence Link plugin. [Read this comment from the development team for more details|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63769?focusedCommentId=1049872&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1049872].
fields.summary: Jira failing to load Confluence page link titles when viewing issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Race condition happening when logging work on JIRA when using DefaultTimeTrackingIssueUpdater#updateIssueOnWorklogCreate.
We have identified that this is mostly happening when using external add-ons to log work. Particularly older versions of the "worklog assistant"

h3. Environment
All - Cloud and Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log work using an external add-on like "Worklog Assistant"
# Check the issue history and the actual worklog to verify the consistency between them.

h3. Expected Results
They are the same, no difference and the reports all show the exact logged values.

h3. Actual Results
Due to a racing condition, sometimes the log work diverges between history and the actual value logged.
This will cause the Time Tracking system to be incorrect in JIRA issues.

h3. Workaround
Not available.
fields.summary: Race condition happening when logging work on JIRA when using DefaultTimeTrackingIssueUpdater#updateIssueOnWorklogCreate

h3. Summary

When you clear the contents of the comment field in visual mode, then add text, the *Add* button remains disabled.

http://recordit.co/6dSqe2HKih
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the comment and switch to visual mode
 # Add some text into it
 # You shall see that the *Add* button is now clickable
 # Then backspace and clear all the text written
 # Type some more text

h3. Expected Results

The *Add* button on the bottom of the comment field should be clickable
h3. Actual Results

The *Add* button look disabled. It can be used but you may need to click it twice to enable it.
h3. Workaround
 * Refresh the page and add the comment now.
 or
 * Switch to text mode and then back to visual mode.
or
* Submit with {{Ctrl+Enter}} keyboard shourtcut.
fields.summary: When using the Visual Editor (WYSIWYG), in certain situations the "Add" button gets disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63750].
  {panel}

TC39 (the group responsible for adding features to JavaScript / ECMAScript) have a proposal to introduce a new {{global}} variable: [https://github.com/tc39/proposal-global]

This proposal is now at the Stage 3 (candidate) phase, and Firefox recently tried enabling it in a nightly build. Unfortunately they had to turn it off again after discovering compatibility problems with some well-known sites/software, including JIRA. The problem comes down to JIRA using an old version of moment.js.

Upgrading moment.js to at least version 2.9.0 (which contains [the fix|https://github.com/moment/moment/commit/1601cb1dd7b14277ba8b00cb2ece3ce637923080]) should alleviate any future problems with this proposal.

See [https://github.com/tc39/proposal-global/issues/20#issuecomment-271646615] and [https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1328218#c4] for more context.

*Update:* JIRA is also now failing in the newly-released [Safari Technology Preview 21|https://webkit.org/blog/7265/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-21/] due to this problem.
fields.summary: Upgrade moment.js to avoid future browser compatibility issues

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63748].
  {panel}

As a user, I want to put a full JIRA issue URL into my commit messages in GitHub, so that I have a convenient link to the JIRA issue.  However, Smart Commit transitions only seem to work with the JIRA issue key.  For example, this works:

JRA-123 #resolve this is fixed

...but this does not:

[https://jira.mycompany.com/browse/JRA-123] #resolve this is fixed 

The DVCS connection works perfectly with the full URL so it shouldn't be difficult to make the transition fire on the full URL too.  Thanks!
fields.summary: Smart Commits should allow full JIRA url

h3. *Description*
CSV Export for “Select List (multiple choices)” fields, is very unfriendly compared with prior Export to Excel

I can’t say the CSV is actually wrong, since it may be syntactically correct per CSV file format.  BUT, I consider this is a significant degradation compared with the prior direct Export to Excel, because the prior version was much easier to use the resulting Excel file.

h3. *How to replicate*
 * Create “Test-Field” of type “Select List (multiple choices)”
 ** Set 4 options for the field: “option1”, “option2”, “option3”, “option4”
 * Create a ticket and set “Test-field” with the following options
 ** “option1”, “option2”, “option3”
 * Run a filter with the ticket and show field “Test-Field”
 ** Export / “CSV (Current fields)”
 ** Open directly in Excel (or view the CSV as well)

h3. *Result in Excel*
 * The 3 options for this ticket are each in their own Excel column as if they are totally separate data fields
 ** Row 1 (field names) will have the same field name repeated
 *** Cells A1, B1, C1 will all be = “Custom field (Test-Field)”
 ** Row 2 (Data) will have the 3 options
 *** Cell A2 = option1, B2 = option2, C2 = option3
 ** Note – If there were 4 options selected for this field, then there would be 4 columns of data
 ** So the amount of columns used is variable based on the maximum number needed for the ticket with the most selections
 *** For example, say my filter has 100 records
 *** Most records have 3 options selected, but one of them has 10 options selected
 *** 10 columns will be created for this field, but unused for most of the records

h3. *Expected results* (based on prior Export to Excel option in previous JIRA)
 * 1 column with all the options, each separated by a comma
 * No change in number of columns regardless of how many options selected for this field
 * Row 1 (field names)
 ** Cells A1 = “Test-Field”
 * Row 2 (Data)
 ** Cell A2 = “option1, option2, option3”

h3. *Why is this a problem*
 * We use filter with a large number of records, columns and do analysis, tables, charts etc in Excel
 * When reviewing, this forces much scrolling left to right to find the actual data, because many of our multiple choice columns may have up to 10 values used
 * Some of our work in Excel is automated and based on where a column of data is expected

Note – this is using Excel 2016 (Office 365 ProPlus)
fields.summary: Possibility to export multi-select fields of issue into single column in CSV

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63742].
  {panel}

h3. *Problem Definition*

During the database configuration setup, if the user configured JIRA to use a database user with Default Database configured on MSSQL server, JIRA will not know that on the MSSQL server side, it's actually using the Default Database of the user.

For example:
 # JIRA DB configuration:
 ** {{<url>jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://10.60.3.37:1433;instance=SQLEXPRESS/MOG</url>}}.
 ** {{<username>moga</username>}}.
 # In the SQL Server, I do not have any MOG database.
 # In the SQL Server also, I have set the DB user {{moga}} configured {{MOGA1}} as the Default Database.
 # During the installation, JIRA did not complain that the database does not exist.
 # After setting up JIRA, the MOGA1 database which was empty, now it has all the JIRA tables and data.

Which means, despite the database does not exist, JIRA will use the DB user's Default Database even though in the {{dbconfig.xml}} file is pointing to another database.
h3. *Suggested Solution*

*Documentation update:*

By default, the Default Database for DB users will be {{master}}. The documentation on Connecting JIRA to SQL Server will need an update to highlight that users should not alter the Default Database value for any DB users.
fields.summary: Documentation update on SQL Server connection

h3. *Problem Definition*

During the database configuration setup, if the user configured JIRA to use a database user with Default Database configured on MSSQL server, JIRA will not know that on the MSSQL server side, it's actually using the Default Database of the user.

For example:
 # JIRA DB configuration:
 ** {{<url>jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://10.60.3.37:1433;instance=SQLEXPRESS/MOG</url>}}.
 ** {{<username>moga</username>}}.
 # In the SQL Server, I do not have any MOG database.
 # In the SQL Server also, I have set the DB user {{moga}} configured {{MOGA1}} as the Default Database.
 # During the installation, JIRA did not complain that the database does not exist.
 # After setting up JIRA, the MOGA1 database which was empty, now it has all the JIRA tables and data.

Which means, despite the database does not exist, JIRA will use the DB user's Default Database even though in the {{dbconfig.xml}} file is pointing to another database.
h3. *Suggested Solution*

*Enhancement on JIRA:*

Check if the DB user has any Default Database configured in MSSQL Server. If it is anything other than {{master}} throw a warning to say that this is not a recommended configuration.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Tomcat crashes on startup when JIRA is configured for SSL using {{protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol"}} in server.xml. 
* Connector {{org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol}} was removed in Tomcat 8.5

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.3/Tomcat 8.5.6 installed with SSL per our documentation [Running JIRA applications over SSL or HTTPS | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Running+JIRA+applications+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure JIRA with SSL
 # protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol" set in server.xml as per recommended configuration

h3. Expected Results

JIRA starts with SSL enabled
h3. Actual Results

Tomcat fails and is unable to start. The below exception is thrown in the catalina.out file:
{noformat}
06-Jan-2017 11:46:26.846 SEVERE [main] org.apache.catalina.connector.Connector.<init> Protocol handler instantiation failed
 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:381)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:424)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357)
	at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:264)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.Connector.<init>(Connector.java:74)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.ConnectorCreateRule.begin(ConnectorCreateRule.java:64)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.Digester.startElement(Digester.java:1190)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement(AbstractSAXParser.java:509)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(AbstractXMLDocumentParser.java:182)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:1339)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDriver.next(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:2784)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentScannerImpl.next(XMLDocumentScannerImpl.java:602)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:505)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(XML11Configuration.java:841)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(XML11Configuration.java:770)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XMLParser.parse(XMLParser.java:141)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:1213)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(SAXParserImpl.java:643)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.Digester.parse(Digester.java:1458)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.load(Catalina.java:578)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.load(Catalina.java:629)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.load(Bootstrap.java:311)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap.main(Bootstrap.java:494) {noformat}
h3. Resolution

Modify JIRA_INSTALL/conf/server.xml. Change the protocol on your HTTPS connector to: {{protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"}}
 * If you do not use the HTTP Connector but use the AJP Connector instead, use the AJP NIO protocol instead.
 ** The AJP connector is: {{protocol="org.apache.coyote.ajp.AjpNioProtocol"}}

*Refer to [Upgrade notes for 7.3|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.3.x+upgrade+notes] for instructions. See Running JIRA applications over SSL.*

See [Running JIRA applications over SSL or HTTPS |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Running+JIRA+applications+over+SSL+or+HTTPS] for full directions on running JIRA over SSL or HTTPS.
fields.summary: Tomcat fails to start in 7.3+ due to protocol deprecation in Tomcat 8.5

h3. Summary

The endpoints /rest/api/2/group and /rest/api/2/group/members are not case sensitive, while /rest/api/2/group/user is. 

GETting https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=test  or https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=TesT returns the same results.



h3. Environment
JIRA 1000.670.2


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group named TesT using the rest api
 # GET the group details and members by calling below endpoints, see that all of them works fine:
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=TesT
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=Test
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=test
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group/members?groupname=test
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group/members?groupname=tESt
 # Now try to add or remove a user to the group without paying attention to the cases (e.g. using endpoint https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=test)

h3. Expected Results
The user is added or removed to/from the group

h3. Actual Results
You get the below error message:
{noformat}
{
  "errorMessages": [
    "You cannot add users to groups which are not visible to you."
  ],
  "errors": {}
}  
{noformat}


h3. Notes
Adding the group TesT or test through the UI creates the same group (and it doesn't warn you that a group with the same name already exists).
(Optional - If Necessary)


h3. Workaround
Use case sensitive names.
fields.summary: The REST API endpoints /rest/api/2/group and /rest/api/2/group/members are not case sensitive, while /rest/api/2/group/user is case sensitive

fields.description:
This may be a regression of JRA-43833 - indicates that it's fixed as of 7.0.0
h4. Problem

When connection times out during issue creation. There is no indication of the timeout and the Create Dialog remains, users are then likely to click the "Create" button again. On the server side, issues are indeed created, resulting in duplicate issue creation.
h4. Steps to reproduce:
 # Open up a create dialog
 # Fill out everything you need to successfully create a ticket
 # Open dev tools and enable throttling down to 1 bps up/down (if needed, increase the latency as well)
 # Submit ticket and wait for timeout (failure from UI perspective)
 ## Notice that the "Create" button becomes available to be clicked again
 # Check queue, a ticket was created

The result is that users on unreliable connections at step 4 will see the Create button become available to be clicked again. They will assume that the creation failed and click it again. This is resulting in a significant number of duplicate issues.
h4. Expected Behaviour

User gets a warning about the timeout
h4. Actual Behaviour

There is no indication of anything happening to the user. The 'Create' button simply becomes available again
fields.summary: Create issue timeout has no Message to users

h3. Summary
Currently it's possible to keep selecting Export -> CSV/Excel/Printable/etc from the issue navigator for the same user session and search filter. This can lead to outages ( OutOfMemory ) in larger environments as users can keep attempting to export if JIRA does not respond with the results quickly, resulting in concurrent/duplicate export requests 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for issues in the issue navigator
# Select Export -> CSV 20 times for a large issue search
# Under the right conditions this can cause JIRA to run out of memory
 
h3. Notes
JRA-63665 can cause smaller export requests to allocate large amounts of heap memory

h3.Workaround
None, other than informing users not to select export more than once
fields.summary: Prevent duplicate issue search export requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA starts up, it goes through several phases, any start-up errors detected after the bootstrap component container is initialised and before the full pico container is initialised are not currently displayed correctly in the UI ( a meaningful error page) and a 500 response is returned instead.

As a consequence, the administrator needs to parse through the logs and review stack-traces to understand the nature of the start-up error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Set up a JIRA instance.
 * Modify your database credentials via {{dbconfig.xml}} to be incorrect.
 * Start up JIRA
 * Go to JIRA (\{\{http(s)://<instance-url>/jira}})

h3. Actual Results
 * A 500 response is returned to the browser and a blank page describing that the there was rendering issue whilst attempting to display the page referring the user to the logs for more information.
 * The logs are filled with exceptions related to both issues retrieving JIRA components and database connection failing to be established.

h3. Expected Results
 * The standard error page (Johnson) is displayed correctly, indicating that JIRA is locked for use and that an start-up error has occurred.
 * The logs only have exception output related to the database mis-configuration

h3. Workaround
 * Please refer to the logs and review the output of the stacktraces related to the database misconfiguration so the credentials can be corrected.
fields.summary: Startup errors are not displayed in the UI during JIRA bootstrap

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Somehow in JIRA a particular LDAP user does not get updated from active to inactive


h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Integrate JIRA with AD (or LDAP)
 # Make sure that "Copy User on Login" and "Update User attributes on Login".
 # Set the "Default Group Memberships" to a group that is allowed to login to JIRA.
 # Create a User on AD and Log in using the user.
 # Navigate to _JIRA Administration > User Management > Users_ to clarify that the user is created.
 # Back to AD side, disable or delete the previous user.
 # Login to JIRA using the same user.

h3. Expected Result:
 # JIRA would reject the user and set the user as inactive.

h3. Actual Result:
 # JIRA would reject the user and no user details is not updated for the user, it will stay as active.

h3. Workarounds
# First workaround:
## Login to Jira as a local admin (not in the LDAP directory)
## Edit your directory config to disable "Update User attributes on Login"
## Edit the user to re-enable them
## Edit your directory config to enable "Update User attributes on Login"
# Second workaround:
#* Move the user out of the AD group and add it back in.; disabling/re-enabling seems to not be enough for Jira to refresh the status.

h3. Notes:
 # The user will still be counted towards the license.
 # Admin would not be able to set the user as inactive due to the option "Update User attributes on Login".
 # Other details will be updated but not the Active/Inactive part.
fields.summary: User did not get updated from Active to Inactive with Delegated LDAP

h3. Summary

Users in JIRA are not notified of issues or comments created via email, even if they should. Same users are notified of issues or comments to issues if they are created in UI. We've been able to replicate this consistently in clean instances.

h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud, version: 1000.656.2 (not available in Affects Version/s field)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a ticket via email using User A (with access) - make sure User B is notified for 'Issue Created'
 # Add User B as watcher to the ticket - make sure that watcher are notified for 'Comment created'
 ** This is an example, we could also replicate this by assigning the ticket to User B, instead
 # Add a comment to the ticket via UI (comment 1)
 # As User A send a comment to this ticket via email (comment 2). You can use the notification from comment 1.

h3. Expected Results

User B is notified for issue creation and both comment 1 and comment 2.
h3. Actual Results

User B is only notified on comment 1.
h3. Notes

This is very similar to this bug:
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63582

However, that one is for JIRA Server and for Outlook, so I'm not sure if they are related.
h3. Workaround

From [~jtillett916844748]:

{quote}
a workaround would be to create a filter to look at issues created in the past 15 minutes and create a subscription to fire every 15 minutes. Dirty, but it's something. 
{quote}

Original comment [HERE|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63694?focusedCommentId=1006194&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1006194]
fields.summary: Users are not notified of issues/comments created via Email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63693].
  {panel}

As a JIRA admin, I'd like to know how JIRA is dealing with the attachment structure when creating the subfolders inside the attachment directory.

For example:
 Let's say that your TEST project has the last issue key *TEST-4321*.

 The directory id created by JIRA will be *10000* until the issue key *TEST-10001* is created so JIRA will create the new directory id *20000*.
 
To fix this basically, we'll have to check for each project that has an issue key above 10001 like below:
||Directory id||10000||20000||30000||40000||50000||
||Issue key|1 ~ 10.000|10.001 ~ 20.000|20.001 ~ 30.000|30.001 ~ 40.000|40.001 ~ 50.000|


We found this external article with great informations about this: [Handling millions of attachments in JIRA|http://blog.valiantys.com/en/jira-en/million-jira-issues].
fields.summary: Attachment Directory ID

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63686].
  {panel}

I followed a link to an issue which had a trailing comma after the issue key in the URL. It displayed with no indication that there was a problem. On trying to add a comment, I got the Communications Breakdown error ("The JIRA server could not be contacted.").
* An example of how this can occur is ending a sentence in a Google Doc or email with the Jira URL. The link could include the end of sentence punctuation.

While this is clearly an edge case, it happened on a link that was detected in text, with the following comma being included in the URL.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
1. Open a issue and add "," (comma) to the end of the url. This could happen when user click on a link in a chatroom.
2. Add a comment to the issue.

*Expected Result:*
Some earlier indication that there's a problem, or for all operations to work. An upfront 404, redirection to the correct URL or for commenting to work.
* In versions prior to 7.2.0 the issue would not load. "Issue does not exist" or "This issue can't be viewed"

*Actual Result:*
Got the Communications Breakdown error ("The JIRA server could not be contacted.").
fields.summary: Unable to comment on issue when URL includes trailing characters

h3. Summary
Project navigation sidebar items do not display with Safari 9.1.3 browser. Safari 9.1.3 is the latest Safari version available on Mac OSX Mavericks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log on to JIRA using a MAC OSX Mavericks with the latest available Safari version for this OS - Safari 9.1.3

Sidebar items and icons are visible.

h3. Actual Results
Sidebar items are not rendered as showing in screenshot below
 !safari-error-console.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
# Problem is not replicable in JIRA 7.1.x
# Safari 9.1.3 is the latest Safari version supported by Mac OSX Mavericks (released September 1, 2016), so should ideally be supported according to our supported platforms.
# Some windows.performance.now() errors are noticed in the browser development tools console when the problem is reproduced in JIRA 7.2.x. Apparently Safari 9 on Mac OSX Maverick doesn't work with windows.performance.now(), it's not clear how this affects rendering of the sidebar items.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA will *not* be migrating users from Internal Directory to Delegated directory if the users has comments/assignee/reporting in an issue. Theses users will be *copied* to the Delegated directory and the users in Internal will be left exist with inactive and [ X ] added next to its Display Name. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up JIRA with Internal users that has activities comments/assignee/reporter
# Set up Delegated connected to it
# Click on "Migrate users from one directory to another" in _Administrator > User management > User directories_
# Process will complete correctly
# Checking the database will show that these users continue to exist in Internal directory as per the data

h3. Expected Results
Users are migrated correctly

h3. Actual Results
Users are copied to Delegated directory. Duplicate entries of the same usernames will exist in JIRA database

h3. Notes
Users that has no activity in JIRA will be migrated correctly

h3.Workaround
* Moving delegated directory on top of Internal will show the correct users represented in the UI
* Manual cleaning of the Internal directory on the database may be required
fields.summary: Users are set Inactive and [ X ] when migrating users from Internal Directory to Delegated

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Lucene Search with unlimited PageFilter causes unnecessarily memory allocation for enterprise instances (1M+ issues).

In many places unlimited PageFilter is used in JQL queries (Agile board, plugins such as JQL Tricks). This leads to the allocation of an array which has number of documents items, where number of documents is typically greater than number of issues.

For 1M+ issues the object size usually is greater than G1HeapRegionSize/2 so it's humongous object. Take a look at related issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63315 to see why humongous objects are painful.
h3. Environment
 * instance with 1M+ issues
 * JIRA 6.4.13+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure JVM to use at most 32g (exclusive, for xms and xmx). It might be easier to use less memory and then the problem should be visible with less issues.
# Enable GC logging: {{-XX:+PrintGCDetails -XX:+PrintGCTimeStamps -XX:+PrintReferenceGC -XX:+PrintAdaptiveSizePolicy}} 
 # Any search with unlimited PageFilter is fine. It can be Agile board (default filter seems to use unlimited result set) or eg. linkedIssuesInQuery function from JQL Tricks plugin.
 # Single request is not enough. Try to do thousands of them within a minute.
 # Observe in GC logs:
{noformat}
2016-12-23T09:35:27.143-0500: 84706.348: [GC pause (G1 Humongous Allocation) (young) (initial-mark)
Desired survivor size 75497472 bytes, new threshold 1 (max 15)
- age 1: 187032496 bytes, 187032496 total
- age 2: 41910368 bytes, 228942864 total
, 0.3112215 secs]{noformat}
and eventually frequent Humongous Allocation will cause high memory pressure and could lead to frequent  Full GC:
{noformat}
2016-12-23T09:51:09.273-0500: 85648.478: [Full GC (Allocation Failure) 15G->5439M(20G), 22.7404778 secs]
[Eden: 0.0B(1120.0M)->0.0B(1336.0M) Survivors: 0.0B->0.0B Heap: 15.8G(22.0G)->5439.5M(20.0G)], [Metaspace: 471107K->471107K(1523712K)]
[Times: user=35.18 sys=0.02, real=22.74 secs]{noformat}
h3. Expected Results

Search does not cause Humongous Allocation without the good reason.
h3. Actual Results

Humongous Allocations are present, and also Full GC (Allocation Failure) may happen slowing down the whole instance.
h3. Notes
As part of the fix, additional logging will be be implemented. To enable it:
* {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider}} should be set to DEBUG level.
It logs only queries which try to fetch more than 1000 documents. 

 
h3. Workaround

For some cases, increasing xms may help to fit into bigger G1HeapRegionSize.
fields.summary: Lucene Search with unlimited PageFilter causes unnecessary memory allocation

  {panel}

h3. +*Issue Summary*+

The download link for *installer* on our [official page meant for installing JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/installing-jira-applications-on-windows-from-zip-file-855475651.html#InstallingJIRAapplicationsonWindowsfromZipFile-1.DownloadJIRA] is wrong redirecting to the draft of a different page.

h3. +*Steps To Reproduce*+
# Go to [this link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/installing-jira-applications-on-windows-from-zip-file-855475651.html#InstallingJIRAapplicationsonWindowsfromZipFile-1.DownloadJIRA] for installing JIRA on Windows
# Click on the link Installer.

h3. +*Expected Result*+

JIRA would Link you to the page where users can download the installer for JIRA.

h3. +*Actual Result*+

User is redirected to [this link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/~rrobins/installing-jira-applications-on-windows-828792159.html instead which is a copy of the documentation
fields.summary: The Download Link for JIRA is Pointing to the Wrong Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When right clicking on a large PDF file attachment in a JIRA issue and select "*Print*", the Print Preview screen will display only a part of the pdf file with scroll bars around the border.

h3. Environment
* Tested on the latest version of Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download a large PDF file, preferably a large image.
# Create a new JIRA issue.
# Add the PDF file to the issue.
# Open the PDF file by clicking on the attachment link.
# Right click the preview screen and click "Print".

h3. Expected Results
The Print Preview screen will shrink the image file and display the file in its entirety. 

h3. Actual Results
The image will be cut off and scroll bars will appear on the print preview screen around the edges.
  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This behavior is not observable in JIRA 6.3.15, the Print preview does not show scroll bars around the image and will show the entire image instead.

h3.Workaround
In Mac:
* Right click + Print >> More Options
* Reduce the the Scale to fit the image in the margins

Windows:
* Right Click + Print
* Either Scale to page or Fit to page depending on version of windows
fields.summary: PDF Print preview for large pdf files shows scroll bars
